artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Wakasaya Yoichi
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: vertical ōban diptych; left: standing man wearing primarily purple striped kimono, holding his PL hand behind his ear, at a bamboo gate; blossoming tree behind man; right: started woman looking toward right, with PR hand held out, holding the skirts of her purple and turquoise striped kimono; pink blossoms at top; tray with blue and white plates and bowls behind woman; red cartouche with black text in each top outer corner; five cartouches--three round--in LLC of left sheet with text; five cartouches--three round--in LLC and LRC of right sheet with text
dimension: 14 × 9 3/4 in. (35.56 × 24.7 cm) (image, sheet, vertical ōban, each)
medium: Woodblock prints (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: in toshidama cartouche on each sheet: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
text: The play was performed at Nakamuraza in 1853.
title: Scene from the Kabuki Play, "Yowa nasake ukina no yokogushi"
